VIII.i.1.A.3.d
.
Requesting Records From MRRC in Support of a Korean DMZ Herbicide Claim
RO Research Coordinators should send a request to the VA Military Records Research Center (MRRC) for verification of exposure to herbicides when
a Veteran
claims exposure in Korea, and
did not have service between September 1, 1967, and August 31, 1971, in a unit or entity listed in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart i, 1.A.3.c
.
Notes
:
If the claim and available records do not provide sufficient details of the Veteranâ€™s Korean DMZ service, send a subsequent development letter to the claimant and allow 30 days for a response.
Request and review all available military records prior to submitting a request to MRRC for verification of herbicide exposure.
If the Veteran fails to provide sufficient information to complete an MRRC request, refer the claim to the rating activity.
Reference
:
For more information on referring a claim to the RO Research Coordinator, see the
NWQ
Playbook
.
